patterns: What is AISG?
What does AISG represent?
Role of AISG?
What is AI singapore
Who is AI singapore
What does AI singapore do?
responses: AI Singapore (AISG) is a national AI programme launched by the National Research Foundation (NRF) to anchor deep national capabilities in Artificial Intelligence (AI) thereby creating social and economic impacts, grow the local talent, build an AI ecosystem, and put Singapore on the world map.

AISG is driven by a government-wide partnership comprising NRF, the Smart Nation and Digital Government Office (SNDGO), the Economic Development Board (EDB), the Infocomm Media Development Authority (IMDA), SGInnovate, and the Integrated Health Information Systems (IHiS).

patterns: What is AIAP?
What does AIAP represent?
AIAP is about
what do AIAP do
is AIAP a course
AIAP is a job ?
responses: The AI Apprenticeship Programme (AIAP)® seeks to develop Singaporean AI talents and enhance career opportunities in AI-related roles. Apprentices will get to work on industry projects and deepen your skills not only in AI and machine learning (ML) but also in software engineering as you learn to deploy AI models into production.

patterns: Will I get a certificate upon completion of AIAP?
What will I get at the end of the course?
Is there any cerification issued?
Who is providing us with the cerification?
will there be a certificate awarded?
Is there a certificate upon completion of the course?
responses: Apprentices who have successfully completed AIAP will receive a certificate from AI Singapore.

responses:

patterns: Do I have to resign from my current job to join the AIAP?
Why do I have to resign as founder or director of my own company?
Is AIAP a full time program?
Can I do the program on part-time basis?
Why it is to be full time committment?
Why do I have to resign from my role?
Do i need to resign from my job
Can i do it as a part time programme?
Why do i need to resign to join?
Can i do it on a part time basis?
responses:
AIAP is a FULL-TIME programme where you will undergo training at an intensive pace over 9/12 months at AI Singapore's office / any appropriate location.

Due to our sponsorship requirements, you are not allowed to take no-pay leave from your current full-time job to attend the programme. In addition, you should not be owner/founder of a company. Apprentices work on industry projects from companies and NDAs have to be signed. Hence during the programme period, apprentices should not be associated with any company.

patterns: What is the monthly training allowance value?
Do I get paid for doing the program?
How much is the allowance?
How much is the pay?
What is the range of the allowance like?
What is the range of the pay like?
Will there be any allowance/pay given while doing the program?
responses: The monthly training allowance is between SGD 3500 to SGD 5500 (dependent on no. of years of working experience and qualification).

patterns: How are projects assigned to AIAP apprentices?

Do we get to choose my own project?

How are project allocated ?

responses: Apprentices will be allowed to indicate their preferences. The mentors will assign the projects considering the apprentices’ preferences and their skill sets to ensure a good fit for the apprentices and the projects.

responses:
In the first 2 months of the AIAP programme (Deep-skilling phase), apprentices will broaden and deepen their knowledge in core AI/ML topics including Neural Networks, Computer Vision, Natural Language Processing and MLOps.

More on What you will learn in AIAP

patterns: Why do I need to have 2 guarantors when I accept the AIAP admission offer?
Do we need guarantors for the aiap course?
How many guarantors do i need?
Why the need for guarantors?
Are guarantors needed to sign up for the course
responses:
As this is a fully sponsored programme, AI Singapore requires all apprentices to have 2 working Singaporeans or Singapore Permanent Residents with minimum annual income of $30,000 as guarantors.

More on guarantors

patterns: How is Assessment 1 conducted?
What is Assessment 1 about?
What can i expect to be tested on for Assessment 1 ?
What will we be tested on for assessment 1?
What can i expect to be assess on for assignment 1
responses:
Assessment 1 is a 60 minutes online assessment and the minimum passing score is 72. It consists of two parts: Coding challenges and Multiple choice questions.

More on Assessment1

responses:
The monthly training allowance value is calculated based on relevant experiences and educational qualifications listed in your curricula vitae (CV) submitted when you apply.

Monthly allowance

responses: There is no CPF contribution as you are not receiving a salary but a training allowance.

responses: As AIAP is a fully sponsored programme, if you drop out of the programme, you will have to reimburse AI Singapore for the monthly training allowance that has been paid out to you and the programme fees.
